It will be up to the governor to turn the recommendations into bills for the Legislature to debate and possibly send back to Green by the time the session ends in May. articles.title: Feeling the Heat? These fossil fuel giants are to blame, new study says
articles.author: Karissa Waddick
articles.summary: Climate change increased the probability and intensity of more than 200 heat waves across the globe over the last two decades, according to a newly published study. The study's lead author, Yann Quilcaille, is a researcher at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology's Institute for Atmospheric and Climate Science in Zurich. He and the other authors examined 213 heat waves from 2000 to 2023 found in the International Disaster Database. About a quarter of those heat waves would have been impossible without human-induced climate change. Fossil fuel companies like ExxonMobil, Chevron, BP and Shell are among the leading contributors.

articles.title: Study Links Oil Giants' Emissions Directly to Dozens of Deadly Heatwaves
articles.author: Damian Carrington
articles.summary: Carbon emissions from the world's biggest fossil fuel companies have been directly linked to dozens of deadly heatwaves for the first time. articles.title: FIRE BAN ADVICE - Darwin And Adelaide River 12 September
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: NT Fire and Emergency Services have declared a 24-hour fire ban for Darwin and Adelaide River for Saturday 13 September 2025. The fire ban is valid from midnight to midnight. articles.summary: Kochi's winters are heating up faster than its summers.
